laboratory_examinations.findings: The donor was heterozygous for a ~1 kb deletion in the CLN3 gene, with the other allele having a single base pair deletion in exon 6 resulting in a frame shift.

Histopathologic studies revealed loss of neurons from all retinal layers, degenerate rods and cones in the far periphery, increased lipofuscin granules in some ocular tissues, and decreased lipofuscin in the retinal pigment epithelium compared to the control.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The retinal degeneration resembled that in retinitis pigmentosa with progressive loss of visual function. Initially showed a bullâ€™s eye macular lesion and questionable pallor at age 5, with an absence of visual function noted at the time of death.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Demonstrated degenerate rods and cones with short outer segments, prominent autofluorescent lipopigment granules in ganglion cells, and fewer lipofuscin granules in the RPE compared to control specimens.
